ratings.comment: He nitpicks when it comes to grading. I honestly never knew what grade I was going to get on a writing assignment because he seemed to grade each one differently. It seemed quite random. He's nice enough I guess, but he can be sarcastic and does single people out at times.

This man... where do I start. During the second week of class, I was called out by JT and told that I should either review the expectations of the class or drop, for speaking english before class. He is passionate about what he teaches but is not afraid to single you out and will not hesitate to use his personal opinion of you while evaluating.

If you go to his office hours to get help on something he's very rude about your mistakes. He's the type of Language instructor that expects you to already be fluent when you walk through the door. I think he'd be a good professor if he wasn't trying to teach language acquisition though because when he moves on to other subjects it's bearable.

JT is overall a likable guy but some aspects of his class are just dumb. You need to memorize pointless terms to regurgitate onto tests-- but that's life. He definitely favors some students over others and always finds the most unimportant things to nit-pick on papers. Sometimes he can be sarcastic, which isn't needed. He's alright.

Very witty, passionate about what he teaches, class can be managed if you figure out what is best for you. Tests are structured the same every time so it is easy to get a good grade if you study appropriately, great man, super funny!
He is so not clear about when to hand in homework, what to hand in and what we are expected to learn.
